data.title: Cut the cable!
data.body:
The Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K has completely transformed my home entertainment setup. The picture quality is stunning, thanks to the 4K Ultra HD streaming capability. Whether I'm binge-watching my favorite series or enjoying a movie night, the clarity and vibrant colors truly enhance the viewing experience.

Setting up the Fire TV Stick was a breeze ‚Äì plug it in, connect to Wi-Fi, and start streaming. The user-friendly interface and voice-controlled remote make navigation effortless. The inclusion of Alexa is a game-changer; simply ask for your favorite show, and it's at your fingertips.

The vast selection of streaming apps ensures there's always something to watch, and the quick responsiveness of the device means no more frustrating lag times. The addition of Dolby Atmos audio takes the audio experience to a whole new level, providing immersive sound that complements the impressive visuals.

The Fire TV Stick 4K has become an essential part of my home entertainment setup, offering a seamless and enjoyable streaming experience. Its powerful and compact design is a game-changer for entertainment on the road. If you're looking to upgrade your home theater, I highly recommend this device ‚Äì it's a compact powerhouse that delivers top-notch performance.

data.title: Powerful and entertaining
data.body: I recently upgraded my internet speed and can now stream video. My HDTV is 10, not smart, so I now have a 4K device for now and for when I upgrade to a newer 4K TV. Setuo was very easy and intuitive. Once the updates were loaded and I logged in I was off and running. So much to watch and Alexa helps me find what I want. This adds a new dimension to my antenna TV. I know I am going to enjoy this device for a long time while I discover more of it's powerful capabilities. It also offers a great picture, even on a HD 1089 set. Fire made sense to me as I have a Fire tablet and Echo. A friend much preferred this to a Roku, which he returned. It also allowed him to cut the cord and save quite a bit.

data.title: Better than smart TV menu, or Roku
data.body:
The Amazon Firestick has radically transformed my TV viewing experience, providing an impressive array of features and content in a compact and user-friendly device.

Setting up the Firestick is a breeze. From plugging it into the HDMI port to connecting it to Wi-Fi, the entire process takes just a few minutes. The easy on-screen instructions guide you through the setup, making it super accessible even for those not familiar with streaming devices.

The vast selection of streaming services available on the Firestick is a major highlight. Whether it's popular platforms like Netflix, Hulu, or Prime Video, or specialized channels for sports, news, or music, the Firestick serves as a one-stop hub for entertainment. The ability to customize and install your additional apps expands the options, allowing users to custom tailor their content library to their unique preferences.

The Firestick's remote control is straightforward and super responsive. The voice command feature, powered by Alexa, adds an extra level of convenience. Simply speaking into the remote allows for quick searches, content navigation, and even controlling smart home devices if integrated, enhancing the overall tech experience.

Streaming quality is impressive, with support for up to 4K resolution and HDR content. The device adapts well to varying internet speeds, ensuring a smooth streaming experience without the dreadful constant buffering. The inclusion of Dolby Atmos support contributes to a more immersive audio experience, especially for those with compatible audio setups.

The Firestick's compact design makes it small and easy to install. Its portability allows users to take their favorite content with them, making it a great option for travel or use in multiple rooms. The included HDMI extender ensures a secure fit, even in tight spaces behind the TV.

Regular software updates from Amazon keep the Firestick's performance optimized and introduce new features. This commitment to continuous improvement enhances the device's longevity and ensures that users have access to the latest enhancements in streaming technology.

In conclusion, the Amazon Firestick is the ultimate game-changer for TV entertainment. Its ease of use, extensive content library, responsive remote control, and impressive streaming capabilities make it a must-have for anyone looking to enhance their media viewing experience with the absolute latest in streaming technology.

data.title: BEST DECISION EVER!
data.body: best decision ever, easy set-up, automatically integrated with my LG tv and soundbar. Moves faster than the Roku it is replacing. Roku had glitches in certain spots, went to those spots with Firestick and no glitch!! service is free if you have Prime which I do, so all the Amazon apps are included giving 1000's of viewing options. soo many too many to choose from! Going to get a second one for the bedroom. goodbye Roku!!

data.title: Patience
data.body: I received this through Fubotv for free. I finally got it connected to my WiFi and it updated. I went to Amazon.com/code to register it and after logging in, I was on a page trying to sell me instructions for registering a firestick via kindle at $2.99. This happened a couple of times. On the third attempt it worked and I got it registered. Firestick improved performance on my apps as opposed to just the smart TV. It use to take up to 20 seconds to change channels on fubo. With firestick it's like its connected to a cable box and snaps to every key press. Netflix is also improved I couldn't get AppleTV+ to work, but that's on apple and their weird 'input the code that was sent to all your devices'. What devices and what code? I cancelled that subscription. When using headphones on Bluetooth, through the smart TV, the sound volume doesn't go above normal, but if Bluetooth fails, the TV's volume will be blaring. Alexa on the remote works very well and is a real convenience. Overall, it's a good enhancement for using TV apps and I recommend it for app use, over just a smart TV alone.

data.title: Converted my DUMB TV to SMART TV
data.body:
The Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K has completely transformed my dumb TV to SMART TV. Setting up the Fire TV Stick was so easy ‚Äì plug it in, connect to Wi-Fi, and start streaming. Easy breezy! The picture quality is great.

The huge selection of streaming apps (free & paid), is impressive. The home screen and remote is very user friendly. I am very happy with my purchase. I will buy another one for my living room SMART TV.

data.title: Great price for a media center device
data.body:
This replaced a WD TV Live Plus for me. It's much more responsive and significantly more/completely reliable at interacting with Windows network shares (samba). It's worked great with Amazon prime streaming, but I mostly use it with a sideloaded Kodi for playing content from my network. The 2 issues I've had with this device are the ads whenever you turn it on and Kodi losing audio connection and having to be restarted whenever the stick decides to put Kodi to sleep. The ads aren't that bad though; all you have to do is hit down a couple times and select the app/content you want to run/watch.

I didn't deduct any stars for the Kodi audio issue since the device isn't really supposed to be used that way anyway.

data.title: Big step up from my LTE stick and works on 4k or 1080p or 720p tv
data.body:
I have been using LTE stick since it came out couple years ago and it has lagging some what especially on start up compared to my Roku 4k that took about 10 seconds from title screen and was ready to go no lag(but don't get me started on the drops)but only thing Roku has over Firestick from beginning is Roku interface is better since from day one ...Firestick had always been plain but once it got started was more reliable especially on streaming live sporting events..and I will always question the 8gb memory eventhough out the box it's a little over 5gb but thats been harped on since beginning of the sticks so enough on that...as far as the new 4k goes very fast and responsive especially if you have Wi-Fi 6 type router...the interface is little better than previous models but still not there compared to Roku...only big gripe is losing voice control remote on this model...I never realized how much I used it until it's no longer there. All in all I am very happy I upgraded and it works great on 4k or 1080p-720p if you dont have 4k tv yet so thats a plus for people with older tv....
OK 3 months later update literally..the stick is still awesome but the LOOONNNGG updates every time you plug it in is long even if you leave it on ( I don't because cause feel it they are very warm even when idol) but if you do you can schedule to check for update and they download like when you are asleep you still have to install download manually and it takes up to 10 12 15 minutes and that's with wifi 6 router ...but once it's up it's fast and good

data.title: Love it more than what I thought I would
data.body: A lot of free apps, a lot of movies. Almost makes you feel like you're sinning if you're religious can't do this. Can't do that but there's so much to do on this and watch even games and also you can get a storage extension that think you just plug into the power stick. I mean I looked it up. They have it on Amazon which I might check it out because technically I tried playing a game. I think the max does better for games supposedly because it mentions it but I only had enough to get this one but I didn't realize I probably could have got the max and made payments on that. It's only $8 payments increments for this which I'll pay it off when I have the money. It's only 5 months six. Yeah five payments thought that was pretty cool. I think that's a prime benefit or something I don't know. Or it's to do with who your purchasing it through that accepts that and it's without application. It's just straight up. You make your five installments not too shabby now that I know that's on Amazon with the payments. Probably do that with a lot of purchases. If it's available, it's definitely convenient and it's low payments and increments five star worth it, especially for the price turns. Your smart TV into a another smart TV. I have mine hooked up to my smart TV because it don't have these apps üòÇ

data.title: Media Streaming Killed The ... (Bugles reference)
data.body:
Streaming device from Amazon. It arrived and initially I thought I had a dud. I had it plugged into a HDMI switcher box and there wasn't any video or audio. Plugged it into a different non-smart TV and it fired right up, so I brought it back to my main TV (also a non-smart tv) which is easily over 12 years old now and still doing what TVs do best (I leave you to determine what that is... *chuckles*). After plugging it directly into one of the four HDMI ports on the back, it worked as intended. Eventually, I pulled it from the TV and plugged it into a roughly 8 year old audio/video receiver for surround sound and it works absolutely fine in it too. Recently, I pulled the plug from satellite TV which was charging too much for programming in terms of my budget and I used my "cost savings" to purchase one of these Firesticks for a more diversified and less costly entertainment solution.

I did learn this device has built-in Bluetooth support, which means you can sync it up with your smart phone or a gaming controller. I personally play quite a few retro games and was pleasantly surprised to discover it's possible to play them on this device by side-loading emulators on it, and that it can go up to roughly Sony PSP level gaming. NOT the heavier 3D games, mind you, but some of the lighter titles of the library work particularly well. Anything at Sony PlayStation 1 level and below that in generation will run flawlessly. Not a bad option to have sitting on the couch or in your favorite over-sized chair with nothing going on a desire to step away from the streaming stuff for a bit. *smiles happily*

Would I recommend it? If you don't have one of these or another device like it, then yes. If you already have something similar or a first generation Firestick, then I'd say no. Pretty straightforward. In my personal case, I didn't have anything like it and now I do. And it performs satisfactorily, I will say in conclusion.

data.title: Great product
data.body: I had not been familiar with the tv sticks until my cable provider is going to offer WiFi only. I was told about the these things and told how and what to stream. I googled what was the best out there and Amazon took the top honors on every site I read so I went to Amazon and they had the buy back or trade In your old device and I had a iPad mini that I traded in with a $5 dollar difference so I jumped on that plus my old device was only taking up space In my drawer. Make a long story short I hooked it up today and it‚Äôs amazing I can‚Äôt believe how much clearer my screen is the hearing what‚Äôs playing is %100 better there‚Äôs no skipping or trying to load it‚Äôs just awesome plus all the free content is the best part. So I‚Äôm going to be buying another one for my other smart tvs. You can‚Äôt lose with this tv firestick plus my friend went with the Roku And can‚Äôt get it working the setup is so easy if I can do it anyone can.

data.title: Making Couch Potatoes Great Again!
data.body:
Behold, the Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K ‚Äì because who needs sunshine when you have a remote control and a couch? This little device is like a magic wand for turning living rooms into entertainment kingdoms.

Setup is so easy, even your technologically challenged neighbor's pet rock could do it. Once it's ready, brace yourself for a cinematic experience that's so crisp and clear, you'll think the actors are right there in your living room, raiding your fridge.

And the remote? It's basically the scepter of laziness. Skip, pause, play ‚Äì it's like having a personal assistant for your binge-watching needs. Just don't be surprised if you start referring to it as "your precious."

In conclusion, the Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K is the unsung hero of every movie night, turning us all into certified couch potatoes. It's so awesome that even your grandma is probably using one to binge-watch her favorite shows. So, grab your popcorn, sink into that cushiony paradise, and let the Fire TV Stick 4K work its pixelated magic!

data.title: It is stuck in a reboot loop. (Not anymore)
data.body:
When we plugged it in it worked just fine. But it updated itself within a minute. And after it updated, it got stuck in an infinite reboot loop.
Even after we unplugged it and plugged it back in, it's stuck in an infinite loop.
Also, we noted that it had already been opened when we got it. So my guess is they reset it at the factory but there is some serious problem with it.

I actually purchased another one, and it had the same problem. What are the odds?

Update:
Upgrading to a 5 star rating!
It turned out that I was not using a power supply with enough power!
You must use the included power supply. When I did, it worked flawlessly!

data.title: Fire stick update
data.body: I have not used a fire stick in quite a few years. It was in Grandma's room so she could watch her show Bones and others. She died this year and so the TV got turned back on. I had to order a new one because I wanted the live features for a BTS concert on the new Weverse's app. It worked perfectly and I was able to get JK's last concert live streamed. On the side notes there are more advertisements so I'm concerned about the younger generations watching the ads. But it does help you keep your mind busy and choosing what show you want to watch next. Also has a live option and I can watch shows live which are often seem to be just repeated. You can have leverage show or Bob Ross show or antique shopping show. A murder station etc I even have a new Asian with love station. Lots of different Asian shows are showing on that.,.......... If you do not have an updated or smart TV this is the way to go. All you need is an HDMI port. ( Do you need the original remote control or the ability to change the HDMI ports on the side of the TV........This is free service if you buy the fire stick. (Yes, there is Netflix and Hulu and others that you can pay for. They also have Vicki Asian channel. So you can buy things and rent things. Make sure you read it before you click the okay button. My mom paid for a bone show for $5 and she now owns that one show in that one season. She did not even get the whole season. Which you can do I'm sure you just have to read all the fine lines. So if you have children in the house you may have to set up the children's safety feature. They are quick to answer your phone calls if you have a problem. Highly recommend this for anyone with an older TV and who is not just sitting on their phone watching all the shows.

data.title: Great streaming stick for a guest bedroom, rental, etc.
data.body:
Pros:
Price
Hardware
Set-up
Simplicity
Compatibility

Cons:
UI/UX
Data (?)

I can't comment on it's integration with audio devices, but setting up the remote to work with my old Magnavox TV was a breeze. It's nice not needing the separate remote to turn the TV on/off and adjust the volume. Hardware is great for the price, but it comes with a downside: Amazon UI/UX. It is designed solely around your engagement with Amazon's service and not for ease of use. Besides AV1 (which you're unlikely to encounter), the 4k stick supports all of the common containers and audio/video codecs I've tested.

data.title: Updates cause glitches....
data.body: It worked perfectly when I first got it. Made the mistake of allowing it to update and now every update there is another issue WITHOUT the prior issue being fixed. Now (after update 3) certain apps don't open unless I go through the "Manage Apps" section. The screen will sometimes shrink, so instead of it covering the whole TV screen, it will shrink to the top left corner taking up only a small fraction of the total area. The only way to fix it is to restart the Fire Stick...a bit aggravated, but it only happened after the updates. I put off updates for a while, but eventually decided to do it and then the problems started. I kept allowing updates because I was hoping the issues would be fixed, but no.

data.title: A is nnot the right grade?
data.body: I had the first edition of the Fire Stick for almost 3 years. Was working (well, sometimes I had to unplug and re-plug again) overall well, with no major issues. I recently purchased this latest 4K edition (not Max), and I encountered several problems: instead of upgrading, I had to install everything from scratch (why is that, makes no sense at all), install the apps again, and sign in with the credentials (please do not say for safety). Now, the home page is full of the movies on Prime (of course, it is an Amazon product) but the apps are scattered everywhere. And, as a dessert, once you're getting back the previous app you liked it, I got a message, "No memory enough, uninstall some to have space". Right Amazon, the previous 1st edition NEVEr gave me such a message. I did a lot of research before I purchased this edition, and I was expecting an easy installation and better work. I am not sure that I made the right selection/choice.. I can only imagine myself if I did purchase the International edition, and being in an EU country, I would experience the same or even worse frustration. It is just a comment...It will be your choice to "be or not to be". Good luck.

data.title: Great change
data.body:
It became clear to us that $320.00 for cable and internet was way out of control.

I was not totally on board as my son had one and he said it was fantastic. It was a bit hard to get use to but what a great change after I got it down pat.

If your cable bill is out of control, buy the Amazon Fire Stick you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Good quality, clear reception!
data.body: bought this for an extra room in our house where I did not have to worry about routing coax cable or need of a router. I was a bit skeptical but was pleasantly suprised on how straight forward the installation and set up was. Having said that, there are a few steps where common sense will guide you, but on the other hand there is plenty of assitance venues for assitance. I especially like that I was able to get connection to all of our already subscribed apps by simple login in and following options on the screen. It will help to have a laptop where you may have to gloin to HULU for instance to register your TV (We pay for unlimited users) I beleieve prime was on screen and since they are both amazon apps, all my content was there already. You will also like that once the initial setup is working, you won't need you primary TV controller. On the included controller you can launch prime, peacock, netflix or direct TV if you are already a sunscriber! I would recommend this product

data.title: Excellent upgrade from original fire stick
data.body:
I have six fire sticks. Five of them on TVs and one for travel. Even though all my TVs are "smart" TVs, it seems that when they are 2 to 3 years old they stop getting updates, so the Fire Stick is there to keep the apps rolling along when the TV manufacturer drops the ball. The reason I got the "All-new Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device" now (November 2023) is that I found out that the 4K fire sticks can show you the video from your Wyze smart cameras. Full screen or as a Picture-in-picture in the top right corner of the screen (great for watching for approaching trick-or-treaters while watching a show). When I tried to show this to my wife on our main family room TV, it didn't work - because it has an original Fire TV Stick from 2017, which does not support that kind of viewing.
So - Black Friday comes and I get a latest model Fire Stick 4K to replace my 2017 model.
One thing I was disappointed with was it appeared that I could transfer all the apps and settings from the old stick over to the new one. This didn't happen. I ended up having to install all the apps myself, and re-login to all the apps. This took about 4 hours! However, when using the new Fire Stick it's performance was amazing! I had buffering issues with the old one and the new one streams flawlessly. Also, one of the 4 buttons on the stick is for DirecTV, which I have. I didn't realize there was a DirectTV app until I saw this button. I was aware of a DirecTV NOW! app, but that was for a different service. The (apparently new) DirectTV app allows you to watch your programs recorded on the DVR, plus all your DirectTV channels, plus On Demand. I have the main DVR and 2 Genies that I can already do this with using the DirectTV hardware, but now I can also watch DirecTV recordings, live tv, and on demand on the other 2 TVs.
And (maybe - needs to be seen) do the same on the Travel Fire Stick while vacationing. A very good upgrade from the original Fire Stick and also a revelation on the availability of the DirecTV app.

data.title: Cutting The Cord? but the Cable Company still wants $80/mo just to provide Internet service.
data.body:
This 4K version is noticeably faster and smoother than the old Fire Stick. And they're both thousands of times faster than the "Smart" circuitry in the Vizio TVs üôÑ

I watch a lot of PlutoTV and Flex. Or is it Plex? Anyway, I am in a state of constant wonderment about the fledgeling Smart TV Advertising Industry, and whether my big TV can tolerate it if I throw my coffee cup at it. Mamasita, Oooooooo....

In summary, after a couple of years of watching commercials on a smart TV, I'm getting close to getting a paid service. Of course, you can subscribe to most any of them on the Fire Stick.

I think you can get them on a computer, too. Pluto, Hulu, etc... You can run HDMI from your computer to the TV, and then you don't need a Fire Stick, or Ruko, or anything. A real computer would provide fastest reaction times, and offer things like recording, time shifting, watching one program while recording another so there'd be no chance of ever turning off the TV... You plug a TV card into the computer, and they come with remote controls...

On another tangent (thanks for tolerating), the least compressed, highest quality video is on digital broadcast TV. I should go into the TV-antenna installation business, if I weren't afraid of heights. But you should start with a rabbit ears antenna duct-taped to your window, and see if you get plenty of free stations that way. Or any stations at all. Then, consider whether or not you'd be interested in improving your antenna system to get more, farther away stations. Make the F connector in the back of your TV work for a living.

data.title: Love it
data.body: I love this one more than the original ones I‚Äôve purchased in the past. All the regular ones stopped working after an year and froze on the startup screen. The picture is so much clearer on my 4k Samsung 55 inch television. I swapped out the old for the new one and seen an amazing performance from the old one. Plus having the volume control on the remote helps me not to have to use two separate remote controls for the television and the fire stick. Also the good thing about Samsung television remotes also control the 4k max firesticks when plugged into them.

data.title: Made my old TV a smart TV!
data.body: Bought a fire stick to make my old non smart television something I could stream Netflix, Hulu, Peacock, Dish Anywhere, etc on. Works great! It is super fast and the only thing I seem to have any issues with is the Dish Anywhere app but I beleive it has to do with the app and not the fire stick. If you're wanting to upgrade your television and don't want to spend a bunch of money buying a fire stick is a heck of a lot cheaper than buying a new smart television and the results are the same!

data.title: Great product
data.body: I loved this Amazon Fire Stick. It was super easy to install on my tv. All I had to do was log in to my Amazon account and it was up and running in a few minutes. The streaming quality is great, with enough memory to prevent buffering issues. If you don't want to spend the extra money on a Fire Cube, this is the way to go.

data.title: Best for streaming movies from a media server
data.body:
I bought a Firestick to stream movies from a media server (just a hard drive connected to the router via a USB port) to my 14-year-old TV using a VLC player. The movies are primarily in MKV, MP4, and AVI formats.
Works like a charm - fast, really good quality. It would be nice to be able to clean up the home page - it's a little bit overwhelming, but it's not a deal breaker.

data.title: Definitely worth upgrading to the newer 4K stick
data.body: My older (2020) fire sticks were getting draggy & annoying. I decided to try the 4K even though my tv is not 4K, because I figured it had better processor. It‚Äôs nice & fast, great video quality (seems sharper even though my tv isn‚Äôt 4K) and I decided to buy a 2nd one for the bedroom even though I hardly watch in there because it was a good deal with trade in of the old one.

data.title: Easy
data.body:
This Fire stick is replacing my second ROKU that bit the dust after 3 months.

This Fire stick was easy to install and is easy to navigate.

I've only been using it for a week but I'm loving it.

The Fire stick offers so much more than my ROKU did.

I'll come back and update if I have any issues but, for now I'm giving this gem 5+ stars for sure.

I hope this was helpful.

data.title: updated review -‚Äú1*‚Äù now ‚Äú4*‚Äù
data.body: original review was 1* and I tried to leave it at bottom of this update. Amazon responded to my review quickly first by phone and then email. At their suggestion I tried troubleshooting and restart. Not sure which action worked but it is more responsive and predictable than before. I have a couple of freezes, jumps to blank screen, and one really odd thing where I selected play for an item and it displayed the previous option screen rather than the one I selected. It did that repeatedly until returned to the home screen and then selected my choice. old review follows - this was a gift from someone the purchase was a hardship. sad because it is this ‚Äúexpletive deleted‚Äù device is infuriating. the menu is cluttered with apps and services amazon wants you to buy and the responsiveness to commands is glacial. every command is a prayer that most certainly will not be answered. the system goes wherever it wants whenever it wants and i'm not sure where i am when i get there. when i try to move from one selection to the next, more often than not it takes me back to the opening screen. if you are a gambler this is the device for you. if you have a low tolerance for frustration then avoid this purchase.

data.title: Easy install to make a TV smart
data.body: Love being able to stream from many platforms just by adding 1 small device very easy to set up and use we now own 2 and recommend to anyone wanting to stream without upgrading to a smart television! This is an instant upgrade for a very reasonable price (also there are zero fees to use this!! So even if you just wanted to watch free platforms the only cost is the device itself agin zero hidden fees to use this)

data.title: When It Works, It's Very Good
data.body: When it worked, I really liked the Fire Stick 4K. But I accidentally pressed the "Manual On" setting. I tried desperately to override it or restart it or restore it to factory settings. Nothing worked, and now the Fire Stick is useless. I now have a blank screen. There should be a way to override this setting, but after a lot of research and trials, I could not find one that worked. This is simply not satisfactory!

data.title: FireTV stick
data.body: I had an old 4k fireTV stick. The remote was old and causing problems and I needed a separate remote to power on my TV and control volume. This new fireTV stick does volume and power and was discounted. So cost was right and the updated version is so much better.

data.title: Wish I'd bought one sooner
data.body: This is my first Fire Stick and my first Alexa device. I don't have a 4k TV but this was on sale and I thought it was a good deal. It lets my old Samsung TV get all the apps I couldn't get before. I only wish Alexa was voice activated. Instead, I have to hold down a button on the remote to use Alexa. I also couldn't get the remote to control my older DVD player.

data.title: Remote issues
data.body:
Update: after my review I was contacted by customer service and they replaced the remote at no charge so I changed my rating from 2 stars to 4.

The fire stick itself is fine the remote eats batteries I have to replace them every 3 days. It was a gift and past the return window but it says it can still be returned but when you start the return it takes you to trouble shooting. I don‚Äôt know who to contact to get a new remote.

data.title: Finally able to cut the cable
data.body: We finally have internet available. We chose this firestick to stream our television programs and movies. Excellent choice, we love it and it works perfectly. It was super easy to install and set up. Comes with an adapter and a very simple remote. It guides you through the install with easy to follow instructions. Highly recommend

data.title: LOTS of programs I don't normally have access to
data.body: I didn't have any idea of the amount of content available until I received this product. There is always something I can at least give a try to see if I enjoy. There is a lot of content from other areas of the country and as long as you have a internet connection it's free. The only drawback seems to be when I Bluetooth it into my hearing aides sometimes the volume seems to vary and I may have to manually up or down the volume.

data.title: Easy Setup, easy TV
data.body: Have had no problems with this unit and was very easy to set up. Just put into the HDMI port of the TV, bring up the feed for that port and use the remote to go through options, sign into services, etc. I would also say that there is great connectivity with this unit as it grabbed WIFI very easily and has a solid connection even with being a good distance away.

data.title: Good replacement
data.body: My old Fire Stick gave up the ghost after 10 or so years. Remote worked but the little hangy thing on the back of the TV didn't. I ordered this new one and it works wonderfully. But dang it, then I happened onto a PC Magazine article that agreed with the wonders of my new Fire Stick but told me that because I am streaming through an older router, II could have ordered an older model and saved ten dollars. Live and hope to learn. Ten dollars!

data.title: An upgrade from older models
data.body:
It's sure better than the old regular fire sticks. Quickly upload and plays the other apps very well.
I do not like the app buttons on the remote... I don't use them. I hate it when i accidentally hit one of them.
It works great with the tv remote so i use it because it's easiest to hold on to. I think they make the remote slippery so you'll buy the non slip cover

data.title: We have one in every TV in the house...
data.body: We have one in every TV in the house...and I travel with one since I can plug into my hotel television and watch my favorite shows and apps. I must have bought 20 of these things over the years...and has changed the way we watch television. Would recommend.

data.title: Love my firestick
data.body: I bought 4 of these to switch to YouTube YV. We cut the cord with DirecTV. It was very easy to set up and use. The price for the Fire stick was $29. I thought that was reasonable. Fire stick all the way. Never going back to satellite.

data.title: Replacement of Firestick with Note on CC
data.body:
I was using a firestick from 2016. My how time flies. I have recently lost all patience with the circling white circle showing delay, delay, delay. I will return and update this review if this doesn't turn out to be a big improvement. I went to my last nerves setting it up when it all should have been quite simple. Password dithering caused the problem, my own and not Amazon's. So far it is looking promising after the initial circling white circles. Hope they do not return!
Later Update: Having succeeded in replacing my fire tv stick and spending time watching some of my favorite programs I am happy to report that the white circles are not taking as long between tasks. I also want to note that I bought this new firetv stick as a Black Friday deal, yippee.
I was asked by Amazon several times to be added to Vine Voice and finally signed up. I thought people on that program got products for free to try out, so I just want to say that is not true in my case at least!
Important Note: I was struggling without captions and none of my control devices I used to use for CC would work under the regime of this new firestick. I finally figured out I had to use the button on top line of firestick that displays three straight lines to gain access to Closed Caption. Hope this helps someone else.

data.title: Fire stick
data.body: My cable vendor just changed routers so either Firestick or Roku must be used. It is pretty effortless using the stream. I do not have the voice recognition or Alexa. Much quicker to locate what you are looking for instead of the regular remote.

data.title: Works Great
data.body: I bought this and 2 Echo smart speakers in order to set up a smart surround sound system for my TV. All in all, I give it 5 stars. I have a Roku that I've been using for several years. The Roku is great and I'm happy with it, but it simply doesn't have the capabilities of this device. This device has been great and I'm very happy with it. It's also a screaming bargin.

data.title: Easy set up
data.body:
I received the product within a day after ordering. The set up was very easy and fairly quick.

I did have issues setting a fire stick previously. It kept getting stuck in the registration process and the update process. When I looked online for a solution, it seemed that others have had the same issue. If you have this issue call the customer service and they will help you. What happened with me, is that the first fire stick tried to delivery to my home around 4am and they could not get through the gate. When I contacted customer service to inform them they can try to deliver again anytime after 6am, they basically cancelled my first delivery and sent a replacement.

When the item arrived, I figured it was the replacement stick. It wasn't though, it was the one they cancelled. During set up, I had all kinds of problems. The next day, another stick arrived. So the one I was trying to set up was deactived because it was reported as lost. Which is why I could not get through the set up process. The 2nd one, I was able to get throug the set up process in less than 10 minutes. I orignally wrote a 1-star review and a representative called me to go over my concerns. I give them 5-stars for caring enough to make the call and their willingness to resolve any issues.

With that said, overall I say the customer service is amazing, quick to respond to any concerns, and the fire stick tv is a product I have been using for years. The only other thing I would recommend is to look into the warranties. Because my fire sticks do not seem to last more than 1 1/2 - 2 years.

data.title: works great
data.body: I had a phone call with a tech. He said my old firestick was bad and I needed new ones. I found out latter that the problem with one of two was a bad charger cube? be sure to check your charger before you purchase a new firestick.

data.title: Update review
data.body:
I have been fire tv user since the begining, I started with fire tv lite and totally renewed my old tv screen, later I jumped to fire tv 4k and 4k max for the other two tv's in the house, now that the lite device is older and slower I upgraded to 4k 2nd gen and it's a really big difference, very happy with the purchase.

2/22/24 - This fire stick started to crash all my apps a couple weeks ago then I did a factory reset and installed everything and the apps were still crashing, I contacted to customer support and they only instructed me to do a hard reset again and hit the update search option, yesterday I contacted again to customer support, and this other guy just told me "I will issue a replacement for your stick but you will be charged $15 for this order" so where's my warranty?? this stick is brand new, after a few words with this guy finally told me "ok once you receive your replacement item the 15 dollar charge will be refunded to you" that was strange but I said ok, I think is fair, he did that job and chat ended, after that I saw a new order in my order history fire stick 4k replacement with a $61.99 charge on it...... what???? more expensive than a new one, so I just canceled that very strange movement from Amazon and I will have to deal with my defective stick :/

data.title: works great as always
data.body: I moved to an apartment and my tv is not a smart tv. These are a great way to get around having to purchase cable tv or get a direct tv box. Works great I bought one for the living room and the bedroom.

data.title: Easy to use
data.body: I plugged it in. It took a few minutes to load and away it went. I have been using it for awhile now and it loads quickly. It is dependent on your internet and the speed. The remote is small and easy to operate even in the dark.

data.title: Samsung Smart TV
data.body: We had bought 2 of these. Neither one would last about a month. They quite working...I don't know if it's compatable with my TV or what. Right before it quites we start to get messages "optimizing your video". One time the TV picture turned pink in color. We unplugged it & tried it on another TV & it worked fine. Then it was saying change the HDMI wire. There is no HDMI with fire TV Stick. Just what comes with it. So Amazon sent a new wire that plugs into the stick then into the TV. It lasted almost a month. Now the TV has a blank screen that says theres no internet. The HDMI port is showning on the TV screen there's nothing plugged into it. So that's what makes us think something isn't compatable..Other than that we love the Firestick TV..Just have to find the right one..

data.title: Keep improving it
data.body: Man, I keep upgrading my Fire Sticks. Every year they get better. Black Friday deal couldn‚Äôt be beat. Bought an extra Stick as a white elephant gift for Christmas. The price was right in line with the budget, but the person who got it, got one of the best gifts because it was worth so much more.

data.title: Very happy
data.body: Just purchased it because it was annoying to use my original remote from Samsung TV (too many buttons and I would constantly press wrong one if not paying enough attention). But I was surprised when I actually loved this new Fire TV. Easy to setup, use and install my favorites

data.title: Works great, for a shorter than expected period of time
data.body: We can always tell when we need a new fire stick. Movies will cut out, at first, infrequently, then every five minutes, and nothing else is wrong after some troubleshooting. So we order another fire stick, which arrives amazingly fast with our prime membership, and once installed, everything works fine, Disney Plus, HBO Max, etc. Checking my purchases, it looks like we have to buy a new fire stick every year. So that‚Äôs the downside, the constant replacement to be able to watch what we already pay for, the upside being it arrives quickly, usually on sale, and all is good after we hook it up.

data.title: Updated Fire TV
data.body: My old fire TV stick wasn't working well, so I purchased this one. Great streaming quality, super compact, and since it is connected to your Amazon account, you only have to log in to your services once and you're good to go wherever you use it. I also like that I don't have to navigate it with my phone, but instead it has a dedicated remote. Highly recommend picking this up!

data.title: Works great, but‚Ä¶Updated
data.body:
Really love this so far. I‚Äôve had it for about a month and haven‚Äôt had any of the app issues others have talked about. All of mine populated with their graphics, etc within a few hours of being installed. That wasn‚Äôt as fast as usual, but I can‚Äôt use them all at once either so I wasn‚Äôt too worried about it.

I typically use this later at night in my bedroom on an LG TV that was my Mom‚Äôs. It‚Äôs a nice, larger TV that is not a smart TV and not connected to cable either so I really wasn‚Äôt sure how this would perform. It hasn‚Äôt let me down yet. And I‚Äôm very familiar with Amazon products. This is my 3rd Fire Stick and I also have a 42‚Äù Fire TV. It responds quickly, doesn‚Äôt lag during streaming (which is all I use it for) and I have only had to reboot it once.

My biggest complaint about this remote is that they didn‚Äôt add the light up in the dark option like they did when they upgraded the other stand alone version. What gives with that Amazon?? And I‚Äôm fairly certain this one costs more too (I think that remote is $39??). I understand this one is also a Fire Stick, but shouldn‚Äôt that mean is going to better?? More bang for your buck type thing. That‚Äôs my logic at least ;-)

Boo is all I can say to that. And double boo for removing Hulu off the bottom and adding Direct TV/Peacock. And there‚Äôs no extra button to add your own. Yes, I can ask Alexa to do it. I just don‚Äôt want to. I‚Äôd rather have my button back‚Ä¶but I‚Äôll deal.

11/11/23 Updated: I‚Äôm adding this as it has begun to wear on my last nerve recently. I stream on my Fire TV ALL the time right now as I broke my ankle. A couple hours before I go to sleep I lay in bed continuing to watch whatever was on. Problem being is that when I go to launch the show from the ‚Äúcontinue watching‚Äù it is NEVER in the right spot anymore! And I‚Äôm talking the completely wrong season even with plenty of time allowed for it to update itself once I‚Äôve shut off my Fire TV. Paramount+ is the biggest culprit of this recently.
And then you may not even find it in the programs listed. I use my subscription via Prime because the PP app is wonky and I‚Äôm not paying Paramount for a sketchy app. Soooo I then have to go to the search feature and look the damn thing up‚Ä¶UGH!! Really?!? Please run an update and make my 11-12pm more pleasant‚Ä¶PLEASE!!! Yes, I know this sounds petty and maybe even stupid to some, but it‚Äôs inconvenient and not what I paid for. I‚Äôm also seriously impatient w/a squirrel brain. So there‚Äôs that‚Ä¶

data.title: Nice addition to ‚Äúcutting the cord‚Äù
data.body:
I started off a year ago dropping ATT to go all WiFi. Went to T-Mobile WiFi routing and Hulu Live. Already had Prime, HBO, And Showtime/Paramont+. I now have 9 Fire Sticks, even one in my RV!
Wait for a sale for the newest mode and forge ahead!

data.title: Best bang for the buck streaming device.
data.body: Very easy to set up/does most of its updating chores without user intervention. A little unnerving how integrated with Amazon it is, but doesn't seem to run away with charges to your account. Good reception even with hard-to-reach WiFi access points, and response with its remote is instant. Plenty of services, Free and pay-for out there for it. Couldn't get Miracast (PC-to-TV link) to work at all, but an app called "Air Server" and the use of Chrome Browser facilitated what I needed there.

data.title: Works very well
data.body: We don‚Äôt use it often but when we do we have no complaints except one. We cannot adjust the TV volume by using this controller. Not a big deal as we use the TV or cable controllers to adjust volume. Were satisfied with this purchase.

data.title: Super clear picture quality
data.body: I was going to go with the regular firestick but decided to go ahead and upgrade to this one and I am happy I did. The picture quality on this one is very noticeable than the regular standard one. This costs a little more but it's worth every penny.

data.title: A must upgrade from older Fire stick!
data.body: I purchased a simple model FireTV stick 6 years ago. I was happy with it until this past year. I noticed a lot of my streamed shows were laggy and often the audio and video would unsync. I upgraded my internet service and bought a powerful Wifi router. I un-installed extraneous apps and made sure everything was up to date. Nothing helped. I slowly realized that the FireTV stick was obsolete. My TV is not 4K, it was purchased just after those were released and too expensive. But it is a high quality HD TV. But I purchased the 4K FireTV stick since I will probably have to replace my TV in a few years, maybe. And I am glad I did! No more lag. Audio/video stays synced. No 'hiccuping' skips during streaming. And the quality of the picture is awesome. I can only imagine what it would look like on a 4K capable TV! I highly recommend it. I also love the extra capability of the remote. It had no problem detecting my TV and allows me to change volume and turn TV on/off. No more juggling with the TV remote. I could swoon. Lol.

data.title: It works
data.body: We upgraded our old Fire Stick for this model. Before, we'd stopped watching TV completely because it just wouldn't load and when we finally, after many tries, got something on tv, it would skip back 20 minutes every 30 minutes or so - even of things that were DVRd. This stick works. Loading is fast and easy, no buffering during the show, and is very responsive. It also eliminated the need for a TV remote to control volume and turn the TV on and off. That's always a big plus. Overall, we are very happy that we upgraded.

data.title: Worse than the orignal!
data.body:
UPDATE: found it! Issue 1. a setting in display control HDR or something; 2. this stick needs the short HDMI extension cord to avoid network problems. 4 stars for now.
What the hell?!? I bought https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08C1W5N87/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1 a year ago and it was just fine but I decided to upgrade to the 4k model and this thing sucks. Everything is wrong about it. It freezes all the time, video is of low quality.

data.title: Decent streaming emulator!..
data.body: If you hate paying for cable like I do, then buy one of these and google how to ‚Äòside load‚Äô .. there‚Äôs lots of videos about how to do this properly and don‚Äôt forget a vpn, cause if you‚Äôre going to stream copywritten content then you don‚Äôt want to give them your real up address, lol free tv and movies for all #ContentPirate #CopywriteSchnopywrite #StreammingPirate üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è

data.title: Probably a good device
data.body:
While this is probably a good device they recently made it unnecessarily difficult to access the Developers Menu Options and after I figured that out it did not help resolve the issue that I had purchased it to do. That is not the fault of the device, itself.
I did not try out any of the streaming apps so I have nothing to say about it. It is easy to connect to the TV and to setup the Wi-Fi in my opinion. Amazon allowed me to return it and refunded my money after they received it.
If I have need of a streaming device in the future I would probably buy a All-new Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device.

data.title: Good but.....
data.body: So far I like it but I have a few issues with it. One during live sports I get buffering now and then despite being on my fastest WiFi network (300+Mbps) the second issue is it claims to support WiFi 6 yet can't find my WiFi 6 network even though all my other devices do without issue. I'll see what happens with future updates and I'll edit my review accordingly.

data.title: Kicked satellite and went fire stick streaming
data.body: When we kicked cable, my husband was concerned because he is not tech savvy. No worries with this fire stick. He can find hundreds of shows from the apps we have downloaded. I was using a streaming device from my internet provider for a second tv but it did t offer as many apps so this was my second stick and my guests use it easily too.

data.title: Inexpensive way to watch streaming TV
data.body:
I have a FireTV ok each of my home TVs.
So far, the only problem I had with them is a temporary loss of the audio sync, that can be corrected resetting the device. Hopefully they‚Äôll fix this in future versions or in a firmware update.

data.title: Convert your old TV into a smart one
data.body: I was about to threw way a 75" old TV but with the fire stick I can use it for many more years now, it works just like any other smart TV, it's amazing!! I can have any streaming platforms, live tv, music and Alexa

data.title: It's run extremely smooth.üòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ
data.body: What I like about the firetv stick 4k,it's excellent clear picture when you play the streaming YouTube including Disney-plus and Netflix both of them I saw already and it's perfect WOW! Iüòçit,I highly recommend to buy it to upgrade the fire stick two thumbs upüëçüëç.

data.title: Greatfor Restoring older Digital Streaming Capability
data.body: We have an older Samsung Smart TV that does not automatically update its streaming capability. The Fire Stick Greatly Improved its streaming capability. And it is much cheaper than buying a new TV. Highly recommend it for owners of older Smart TVs.

data.title: Still on my statement
data.body: I see that it was picked up, as I thought. Unfortunately I'm still going to have to pay my Discover bill. Every time I check online it still says I owe $26.65. I presume once I pay it, my next statement will say -26.65 and I owe nothing that month. Also, I will have $26.65 to charge on something else before I owe anything.

data.title: Nice streaming stick
data.body: I purchased 2 of these on sale during Black Friday (what a bargain). The installation was very easy, and I was able to install my additional streaming applications as needed. It works great over my WI-FI. I am very happy with this purchase and would not hesitate to purchase additional if/when needed in the future.

data.title: Bought for Parents
data.body: I bought 2 of these, one for each of my parents‚Äô televisions. My parents like them and took awhile to get used to but like better than cable. There cable bill was at $300 a month. With the fire stick and both orange and blue sling, we are at $100. I definitely recommend.

data.title: Spot ON
data.body:
As advertised for sure. Easy & simple direction to install.
Easy to set up on TV and start streaming all your favorites.

First one bought was delayed twice on delivery. Took 9 days to deliver from time ordered.
Ordered a second one and was delivered one day ahead of schedule delivery, 4 day delivery.
Company is extremely slow to deliver. NO next day by Amazon/seller.

data.title: Excellent Product for use with Smart TV's
data.body: While most smart TV's have built in features and a remote to configure apps, the Fire TV Stick 4k adds a whole new dimension to viewing experience. Extremely easy to configure and with voice recognition makes for a rewarding experience when watching television. Having used other remote devices I find the Fire stick to add more convenience to installing and using streaming apps. Very happy with this product.

data.title: Web Browser
data.body:
I bought this specifically because it has a web browser that allows me to access my home security cameras in the browser. Roku and the other streaming devices [hello Chrome] cut out the browsers... As if todays streaming world doesn't ever want to brows the web on their TV... smh

Thank you Amazon for leaving the Browser in your streaming device.

data.title: Updated: Hit or miss with my re-registration
data.body: Forget about it being registered to you when you receive it. You get to go to the magical process of doing it yourself, which I found to be a pain in the rear, since I had to relocate passwords. UPDATED: Tech Support contacted me regarding this item. One item was my misunderstanding: have to locate passwords for Netflix and Peacock. The second item was I had registered the device to myself however it connected my WiFi before registration. Customer service outstanding- the only item was registration was not the same as compared to the past.

data.title: Fast & Updated
data.body:
Buying this was a long time coming. My previous Firestick was 6 years old and started to get really laggy and freezing on me.

I love how fast this one is. One of my favorite things about this updated model, is that I can use my over the ear Bluetooth headset with it and actually adjust the volume, unlike with previous models.

data.title: Works good for my first son who has autism
data.body: My first son asked me for this. Since he can‚Äôt have a Xfinity Cable Box and our xfinity bill is very expensive and can‚Äôt have a new TV for his bedroom . He loves all streaming apps and free live TV in 4K HDR.
